laboratory_examinations.findings: FT4: 37.6 pmol/L (normal range 12.0–25.0); FT3: 2.60 pmol/L (normal range 3.6–8.5); TSH: 1.4 mU/L (normal).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Thyroid function test abnormalities (high serum T4 and low T3 concentrations in the presence of a normal serum TSH level) were persistent during the initial 7-month period of observation.
No changes in serum selenium levels observed despite treatment with sodium selenite for 6 months and later selenomethionine for 4 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Peak GH response: 11.2 mU/L; Cortisol: 668 nmol/L.
Proband: Serum GPx: 7 mU/mL; Leukocytes GPx: 0.61 mU/mg protein. Both parents were normal with significantly higher values.
